mluke | Overtime:
Hi everyone, mluke here, a core contributor since September 2023. This is my second time running for council.

In the past few months, I have been focused on getting as many people to try Overtime as possible. This has mostly taken place in betting communities on X, and lately, Farcaster, where I believe there is so much more potential for user growth.

This experience has allowed me to see the product with different eyes: those not used to switching between networks, Overtime/EOA accounts, or even using wallet addresses & making crypto deposits. I‚Äôve seen how new users (both normies and those versed in crypto) think and where they stumble during onboarding.

Overtime has made big steps in improving onboarding for a wider audience, but there‚Äôs still ways to go. I believe my everyday experience from the trenches positions me uniquely to help the protocol improve in reaching new people and making them stay.

keenanallen:
Hello all, fairly new here , but I would like to be considered for a term on the council. I‚Äôve always been obsessed with decentralized gambling protocols and I genuinely believe they will account for the vast majority of the gambling market in the future. I think Overtime is on the verge of a major growth spurt, and I‚Äôd love to be a part of it. Figured the best way to do this is just outline some issues I see and what I‚Äôd recommend.

After spending time with the dApp and reviewing the improvement proposals, I see liquidity per market as one of the biggest constraints. I agree with Chaz that ‚Äúwe have to start asking how we can generally draw non-native crypto people to Overtime and make it feel like they aren‚Äôt using a crypto dApp.‚Äù The UI can certainly be improved, but the real key to attracting and retaining non-native crypto bettors is ensuring they can bet what they want, when they want, just like they can on an offshore book or PPH. Limiting their ability to place live bets, props, or higher-limit wagers is exactly what would drive them away.

I would propose developing a new liquidity protocol that enables all bets to have a max payout of around $20k. For wagers above a certain threshold, we can explore using automated arbitrage through a decentralized platform, as mentioned previously.
One of Overtime‚Äôs biggest selling points is the ability for bettors to contribute to LP tokens and effectively become part of the house.  I recommend removing lock-ups for adding LP, while implementing logic to adjust for collateral in use during deposit or withdrawal.

What Overtime does exceptionally well is its functional tokenomics. Using protocol revenue to increase the value of what is essentially the ‚Äúshareholder‚Äù position is something most companies fail to execute, and it drives me insane. Overtime actually gets this part right.

I‚Äôm also a full-stack engineer and run a lead-generation/advertising agency, if either of those skill sets could be useful.

Thanks, 0xd1a7409df742b91dc9390759977aed0c3a30033e

Introduction:

I‚Äôm running for Council to contribute at the governance level and help steward the protocol through its next phase of growth.

‚∏ª
Impact on Overtime‚Äôs Growth:
My involvement hasn‚Äôt just been as a user; it‚Äôs been about driving adoption.

I‚Äôve supported Overtime since its earliest days, not passively, but by bringing users, volume, and attention to the protocol. I believe in the team, the product, and the opportunity ahead.
